questions.text: In the beginning of the episode, George and Jerry are working on the pilot episode of their sitcom.  Who are they trying to fit into the scene?
questions.explanation:
Elaine.

	Much like the first episode of "Seinfeld", Elaine is not included at all.  Elaine first appears in the second episode of the show.  At this point, Jerry and George are on a roll with their pilot and they're creating lots of funny jokes, but they decide to leave Elaine's character out because there would be too many characters to keep track of.

questions.text: How many days did Jerry and Gail date for?
questions.explanation:
Three.

	Over the three days, Gail and Jerry never made physical contact, and Jerry ends up using that fact as one of his reasons for breaking up with her.  Kramer runs into Gail on the street and he ends up avoiding her for Jerry's sake.  Gail ends up finding Jerry in Monk's.

questions.text: Who did George have read the script?
questions.explanation:
His therapist.

	When George asks his therapist about the script, she says that she didn't like it, and George gets angry with her.  The therapist also appeared in the episode "The Pick", which aired a few weeks prior to "The Shoes".

questions.text: Who pays for George's therapy sessions?
questions.explanation:
His mother.

	George argues with Elaine after the therapist criticizes the script because Elaine recommended her.  Elaine ends up avoiding any conversations about the script because she also didn't enjoy it.

Kramer.

	After snubbing Gail, Kramer saw her again and she began to yell at him.  Eventually, Kramer walked Gail to the building and they began to kiss.  Kramer ended up doing more with Gail than Jerry did in the three times he dated her.

Chef.

	Elaine ends up confronting Gail in a restaurant when she doesn't stop telling people about her shoes.  When Gail hands a dish to a waiter, Elaine ends up accidentally sneezing on the food and it is given to the president of NBC.

questions.text: How old is the president of NBC's daughter in this episode?
questions.explanation:
15 & Fifteen.

	Jerry and George go to Mr. Dalrymple's apartment after he eats the pasta that Elaine sneezed on, and he comments on their script.  He ends up vomiting in the bathroom because he gets sick, and the two leave after Mr. Dalrymple's daughter arrives.  The daughter is played by Denise Richards who appeared in "Starship Troopers" and "Scary Movie 3".

questions.text: After Mr. Dalrymple cancels the pilot, Jerry and George create a plan.  What does Gail want in return for her help in the plan?
questions.explanation:
Elaine's shoes.

	Throughout the episode, Elaine gets angry with Gail for talking about her shoes, and now, Gail wants Elaine's shoes.  Elaine is hesitant to give them up because the likes them so much, but she eventually gives in.

7 1/2.

	Elaine eventually decides to help the guys in the plan by being seductive for Mr. Dalrymple.  Jerry says that he'll repay her with another pair of Botticelli shoes.

questions.text: The pilot of the sitcom is still going ahead as planned in the end of the episode.
questions.explanation:
True.

	After the plan works, Jerry and George manage to get Mr. Dalrymple to bring back the pilot.  Elaine suggests adding the Elaine character into the show and Jerry and George think about it.
